titleStmt.title: Dispatch from Henry Rider to Frederick W. Seward, May 23, 1864

bibl.title: Dispatch from Henry Rider to Frederick W. Seward, May 23, 1864
Despatches from United States Consuls in Sierra Leone, 1858-1906 T-438

div1.p:
John A Parm
To Department of State
Washington D.C.

Acknowledgement of the receipt of Dispatch No 3-4 with inclosed pasports
Delivery of the Records & Archives.
To inform the Department of the delivery of Records, Archives &c of the U.S. Consulate to me by Mr Broadhurst, and a copy of an inventory of same.

United States Consulate
at Sierra Leone Africa
Oct 12th 1878

I have the honor to acknowledge the receipt of your Dispatch No 3-4 with special pasport, under date of the 28 ultimo. The copy of Consular Regulations with a Register of the Department under seperate cover have also been received.

I beg to inform the Department, that on the 4th inst Mr Broadhurst the Acting Consul, delivered to me all of the Records, Flag, Books, and papers he acknowledges to be in his possession, belonging to the U.S. Consulate.

Mr Broadhurst refused to give one an inventory of the Articles delivered, and in order that the Department may see what is now in the Consulate, I have taken an inventory of every thing delivered to me by said Gentlemen as belonging to the U.S. Consulate. A copy of which I have inclosed.
In Entering upon my duties as Consul, I have deferred informing the Authorities here, Officially of my Appointment, until I have received my Commission and Exequatur.

I have the honor to be
Sir
Your Obedient Servant,
John A. Parm
U.S. Consul
div1.fw:
Hon. F. W. Seward
Acting Secretary of State
div1.p: Inventory of the Records, Archives &c received from Mr. J. Broadhurst actg U.S. Consul at Sierra Leone Africa.

1st Records
1 Record of Inventory Statements
1 " " Arrivals & departures of American vessels
1 Inventory Book
1 Seamen Register
1 Marine Extended Protest
1 " Notes of Protests
1 Ships daily Journal
1 Dispatches
1 Miscellaneous Correspondence
1 U.S. Treasury Fees
1 Passport
1 Ledger
1 American Seamen Relieved
1 " Distressed Seamen
3 Blank Books
1 Letters Recieved
1 " Sent
1 " Book
1 Miscellaneous Record Book
1 Instructions to Naval Store Keepers and Pursers
1 Log Book
2nd Books Leather Bound
1 Wheaton's Elements of International Law
2 U.S. Statutes of Large
3rd Books Cloth Bound
4 Diplomatic Correspondence
5 Commercial Relations
1 Customs Regulations
4th Books Pamphlet
3 Statutes of the U.S.A.
10 " at Large
4 List of Diplomatic & Consul Officers
1 Heyl's Rates of duties on Imports
5th
1 Flag
6th
4 Seals
7th
1 Post Office Endorsement Box
8th Stationary
3 Reams Letter Paper
20 Doz " Envelopes
25 " Dispatch "
3 Boxes Seals. 1 Red. 2 Blue
1 " Wafers. Box containing 100
2 Pen Staffs
2 Lead Pencils
9th Forms
5 " No 1
112 " " 13
12 " " 15
6 " " 16
17 " " 36
50 " " 37
94 " " 38
74 " " 33
8 " " 47
12 " " 58
20 " " 121
20 " " 144
10th
I beg to state that the stationary is much soiled and yellow from long standing

I have the honor to be
Sir
Your Obedient Servant
John A. Parm
U.S. Consul at Sierra Leone
Oct 12th 1878
div1.fw:
To Hon: F. W. Seward
Acting Secretary of State.
